climbs.name: Surprised by the Chunks Direct AKA Boom Boom Mtn

content.description:
Start the same as

Surprised by the Chunks

, but exit directly out of the roof instead of heading left over the arete. This adds some fun drop knee style moves with a slightly trickier exit. I do not claim to have FA but really liked this problem and wanted to add it. Please update if you have any additional info.
content.location:
Start the same as

Surprised by the Chunks

.

content.description: Start on the obvious rail on the west side of the boulder. Move up and left to the arete, and use the positive holds to top out.
content.location: The downclimb is on the southeast corner. Reference the picture for the starting hold and problem directions.

content.description:
Sit start on the left hand side of the overhung east face. Move up and slightly right on positive holds, and mantle over the lip.

As always, feel free to give me more info in a PM if you know anything, and I'll change it.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There is a boulder in the ground, but it's not over the crux.
content.location: This is on the South/left end of the east face of Guano Boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched the arete. From there, follow the arete's sandy bumps and jugs to the apex, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad or two will be fine. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the easternmost section of Guano's southwest face. Just to the left of the juniper tree.

content.description: Stand start matched at the hueco. From there, place a left heel, make a big reach to the shelf, match on it, bring along the feet, gain a pair of of edges above, use a right hand pinch, work through the bumps, and gain the jugs above for an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the center black streak of Guano's southwest face.

content.description: Sit start matched on a great sidepull. From there, make a big reach with the left hand, heel hook with the right foot, commit to the shelf, traverse left into the stand start, and finish up the remainder.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the northeast face of Guano.

content.description: Sit start in the middle of the east face with two positive holds and a heel hook. Move up into a side pull and then up through to the lip using positive holds.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter are good.
content.location: This is located on the east face right near the middle. The block has seen a lot of traffic, so the starting holds are more than obvious.

content.description:
Stand start with hands matched at the westernmost hueco of the shelf. From there, throw up heel, begin traversing right along the shelf, trade heels, work out the overhang using the jugs, reach the lip, and mantel on top.

This one climbs in the presence of guano. If you can get past that, the problem is good.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is great.
content.location: It traverses the shit-filled shelf on Guano's southwest face.

content.description: Squat start on the right side of the east face of Guano Boulder. Move up using the arete and the positive holds under the roof.
content.location: This is on the northeast corner of the Guano Boulder. Downclimb wherever you can find a place.

content.description: Sit start matched on the great sidepull. From there, reach a big left hand to the shelf, heel hook with the right foot, commit to the shelf, gain a left hand gaston, follow to a right hand edge, match on a jug, then follow the bumps for the finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. It has a perfect landing.
content.location: It climbs the northeast face of Guano.
